data.title: The Wild/Transcript
data.meta_description: (In the haze of a summer afternoon, two lions stretch across a sun-baked rock. A warm wind blows through the larger lion's mane as he stands and looks into the distance. His name is Samson, and he is known for being the most ferocious lion for many miles around) Samson: So there I was, face to...
data.text:
Transcript[]

(In the haze of a summer afternoon, two lions stretch across a sun-baked rock. A warm wind blows through the larger lion's mane as he stands and looks into the distance. His name is Samson, and he is known for being the most ferocious lion for many miles around)

Samson: So there I was, face to face with the biggest, meanest leopard on this side of the Serengeti. And...

Ryan: You roared so loud, his spots flew clean off. Dad, I've heard this like a billion times.

Samson: Do you know the one where I made the laughing hyenas...

Ryan: Cry? Yep.

Samson: The croc attack?

Ryan: Dad.

Samson: OK. Think. Yeah, you do that. All right, Mr. Smart Guy, here's one I know you haven't heard. It all started in the little place I like to call... ...the wild. They were the fastest wildebeests on the savannah. We're talking fast. All the other lions had given up the hunt hours ago, except your old man. Fortunately, I knew a short cut. I thought I had 'em. Until the dust cleared. Classic wildebeest trap.

Ryan: So, what did you do next?

Sam: What did I do?

Ryan: Yeah.

Sam: That's when I gave them the roar.

Ryan: That's it? Sam: Hold on a sec. I only thought it was over. But they had a secret weapon. He was the biggest wildebeest I've ever seen. He was 14 feet tall!

Ryan: Fourteen?

Sam: I meant 1,401 feet tall!

Ryan: Cool.

Sam: And he had two... No, four of the biggest horns I'd ever seen. His breath was red hot! I mean, green. And he hated the environment. To pull this off, I knew I was gonna have to dig deep, deeper than I ever had before. So I swallowed my fear, sucked in the biggest breath I could.

Ryan: Dad, I'm ready!

Sam: You got it?

Ryan: l I got it! I got it! Sam: Well, let him have it! Roar, son!

Story of my life. Your roar stops a herd of wildebeests. Mine makes the babies laugh. Hey, come on. That was much better. - [sighs] - I'm serious! It dropped half an octave. [low voice] It dropped half an octave. And it sure scared me. Made my hair stand up on end. [blows] - Yeah, right, Dad. - [chuckles] OK. Let's take it from the top. I'm done for today. Come on, come on, one more. You were so close. - Maybe it's something technical. - [sighs] Maybe you're not opening your mouth wide enough. Like this. [muffled] Dad, thanks for the technical help, but if you wanted me to roar like you, you'd take me to the wild. Whoa! Hold on a second. We've got everything we could ever want right here. Great lifestyle, three squares a day. And it's boring. I'm never gonna learn how to roar here, Dad. - Ryan. - But don't worry. I finally figured out how we can get to the wild. You did? The pigeons say those green boxes go there. Those boxes are bad news. Stay away. - But, Dad... - Listen, I know you're frustrated, but a lion finds his roar... - [both] Here. I'm... I'm so tired of hearing that, Dad! It's a rat! Get that rat off my baby! A rat'? - [baby cooing] - Hello! [baby] Silly, silly rat. [shudders] Rats do not got bling like this. [woman] You little...! Lastly, that is the ugliest baby I've ever seen! Benny, stealing candy from a baby? Stealing is such a strong word. I prefer "liberating." Uh-huh. Hey, kid, heard the roar. Down another... - Octave. - Octave! [clicks tongue] So you ready to cheer me and your old man as we capture our fifth straight turtle-curling title? - Hmm'? - I can't even roar. How would you even know I'm there? So you really think it dropped an octave? Absolutely. Hmph. What the heck is an octave? Ryan:] I heard that. - Mm...rabbit. - [Benny] Mm. Cholesterol. I'll stick with the nuts. [grunts] I don't know what his problem is, Benny. He's 11, but he's still roaring at a nine-year-old level. Little help here, Sammy? You know what? Maybe you're setting the bar too high, um, with all those stories about Samson the Wild. Hey, he's always loved those stories! They inspire him. OK, OK. I'm not gonna argue with someone who can use my tail as dental floss. Sammy, you go something right there. - Where? - No, no, other side. - Here'? - Oh, uh... [stammering] - Oh, sorry, Benny. - You got it. [announcer] Attention, friends. Stop by the gift shop and get the most popular plush in America: Nigel, the "I-Like-You" Koala. [man] Look, honey! The crazy thing talks! Plush: I'm so cuddly! I like you! [announcer] That's right. He's so cuddly. And better yet, he likes you. Benny: Finally. And the zoo will officially be ours in T-minus three… ...two… ...and showtime! Nigel: Here I come! Hey! Who put that bar there? Larry: That tickles! - Did too! - Did not! - Did too! - Did not! Out of my way, ya bum! There's that moth-eaten koala! Nigel: I've told you flamingos a hundred times, walk. Flamingo: How about an autograph?! Nigel: Don't... [flamingo] Birds! Find the string on his back! So you're havin' a really nice day! ' Guys " Huh? Off my co-captain, now. - Eh, sorry, Samson. - Yah! Nigel: OW! That didn't hurt. Benny: I almost forgot to tell you. I'm gonna ask Bridget out finally. Sam: Slow down, Romeo. You are a squirrel, and she is... Benny: Perfect, right? Look, I know what you're sayin'. Believe me, I got my eyes wide open. Hey, watch where you're goin', you big, big...! Bridget. Bridget: Don't stare at my spots, Benny. My eyes are up here. Benny:[pants] Oh! Oh, of course. I'm so sorry. Oh, oh, this, this is for you, honey. It goes around your left hoof. Bridget: Did you get that out of the trash? Oh, you did! You little trash-picker! Benny: I'm not a "trash-picker." I'm a recycler. That's a lot more romantic. Isn't it? Bridget: Romantic'? Benny: Sam, come here. Bridget: Romantic? Oh, don't mention romance to me, Benny. I've never had a boyfriend. Benny: Great! That settles it. I accept the job… of boyfriend number one. Bridget: Benny, only the female orb-weaver spider will date a male one-twentieth her size. - So there's hope! - And then she eats him. Huh? [groans] But at least he dies happy. [both] Let's get Ryan, dude! Dude! We said that at the same time! Dude. Hey! Hey, Ryan. - [sighs] - Listen, I'm headin' down to the game. I'm gonna see you there, right? Come on, Ryan. We need you. You're our biggest fan. [male voice] Yo, Samson! Ha! I'm your number one fan, man! Whoo! - Whoo! - Thanks, man. Right back at ya! You were saying, Dad'? Ryan, listen. About this afternoon, I was just trying... Dad, fine. I'll go to your game, all right? OK. I'll, uh… see you there, then. [Yawns] Uh... Huh? Come on, dude. Psst! - Dude. - Guess who's here? Eze. Duke. Man, he always guesses. [chuckles] We're gonna stalk the gazelles while everybody's at the game. - You in'? - [chuckles] - [Duke chuckles] - [Eze] Let's go, bro! - Hmm. - [Duke] The Ryanator. Ryan: I'm comm' down. Fish heads! Get your ice-cold fish heads! Now eyeball-free! We're into the final period of the curling championships, and the penguins are up. Here comes Victor. Penguin MC: What a beauty! Yeah, sweep! It's heading straight for the red bull's-eye! This could be it, folks! ' Yes! - - Oh, yeah! - That's gonna be tough to beat. What? "Tough to beat?" That's just the way we like it, right, guys? I can't believe this! If we lose, I'm gonna rip my head off! - And yours! We cannot lose to flightless birds! Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. No one is losing anything around here. As long as we stay focused. By the way, has anyone seen Ryan? Oh! Oh, I know! Maybe he's sulking 'cause he lives in his father's shadow and he roars like a schoolgirl. - Thanks, Lav. - You betcha! ' Nigel! Nigel! " [groans] - Will you sign my dolly? - [sighs] Not again. [Samson] Nigel, ignore them. I'm so cuddly! I like you! You're so cuddly! We love you! [giggling] That's it! I am not cuddly! I'm a vicious jungle animal from the streets of London! - Fear me! Ha! - Get him! Get him! Get him! Ow! Help me! Girls! Put him down. I am not a doll! - Cushy tushy! - Ahh! Leave my bum alone! Benny: Nigel! Get your paws off my girlfriend! Nigel: Benny, I am not your girlfriend! Plush: Really nice day! Penguin MC: What is up with Samson's team tonight? Brutal! Bridget: Benny? Benny, Benny, Benny, Benny! Oh, my gosh! Who knows mouth-to-mouth?! Benny: I do! [kissing] Bridget:[groaning] What was that'? Benny:Just your daily dose of vitamin Benny, baby. Bridget: Get off my nose. Plush: I'm so cuddly, I like you! Nigel: Stop saying that! - G'day, mate! Cannonball! [Benny] Whoa! Next year, I should just coach. Check it. The Thomson gazelle. Zero to 5O in four-point-five seconds. The ultimate fleeing machine. There is no substitute. Let's get a closer look at these slim jims. - Shall we? - I think we shall. Maybe we should just go to the game. I thought you wanted to be wild. I bet your dad chased gazelles. Yeah, if he were our age, he would so be rockin' out with us. He'd be in there, runnin' 'em down like they were... - Were... - Gazelles. Yeah, gazelles or somethin'. Ready, man? We'd better not. Oh, yeah? Are you gonna stop us? - Guys, guys. Huh? ' [E26] Here we go! [penguin MC] The whole series comes down to this throw! There's no tomorrow! It's do or die! Ya know what I mean. Guys, guys, I know we're down, but we're gonna pull this out 'cause we're gonna use… ...the secret play. The secret play. Hey, everybody, guess what? We're gonna use the secret play! Larry, the first part of the secret play is keeping it secret. - [Larry] OK. - Follow my lead. I'm going to need a double effort from everybody. Absolutely, captain. Triple effort if you want, sir. Sam: Good. Ready, and... - [all] Break! [Eze] Shh! Quiet. Duke: On three, dude. One, two... No! [yowls] Duke: Uh oh.. Eze: Now you did it, Ryan. Sam: Feelin' mean, Donald? Donald: Bring it on! Penguin MC: Folks, there's pressure on the big guy! Sam: Ready, Bridget'? Bridget: Ready. Sam: Ready, Benny? Benny: Ready! Hey, Samson. It's a shame your little brat isn't here to see you lose. [laughs] I can't hold it! [penguin MC] Oh, no! What are you doin'?! Whoa! And here comes Samson. Look at that guy. Is he a beauty or what? Larry! Bridget! Sweep! What a recovery! He's sendin' in Bridget and Larry to do the job! Sweep faster, Larry! Sweep, sweep, sweep! - I am! - Come on, man! Team Penguin is sending their ace, Victor, to... - Watch it, Victor! - Nyah, watch it yourself, see? Nigel, how are we looking? Oh, no! This could be trouble, folks! This is cheating, and you will die for this. I can't hear you, Nigel. - Move left a bit... - Kee-yah! - Ow! [groans] - [Larry] OK Move left and hit! - Larry, no! - Tally ho! [penguin MC] Whoa, whoa, whoa! What a move! Folks, we are inches away from the greatest upset in turtle-curling history! Oh, no! I can't believe my eyes! Sam: No! Penguin MC: Looks like Samson might have choked! - Nice! - Yes! - Unbelievable! Samson and his team have clinched the title! - No, wait! What the heck? The penguins have done it! They're zoo champs for the first time! Sam: Stampede? Stampede! Ryan: Please! Stop! Duke: Dude. Busted. [Eze] Catastrophic. Ryan: Told you I'd come to the game. Sam: You think this is funny'? You just endangered everyone in the zoo! Ryan: I'm sorry. Sam: For what? Chasing the gazelles or costing us the game? All you do is sit in your tree and sulk. Ryan: If you would just… Sam: What's the problem? Is all this because you can't roar? Ryan, I didn't mean that. Ryan: You know what I'm doing when I'm sulking up in my tree? I'm thinking how great it would be if Samson the Wild wasn't my father. Sam: Huh? Ryan, I... I didn't... Ryan: 'Cause it would make being Ryan the Lame a whole lot easier. Sam: Ryan, I'm sorry. Ryan! Please don't… leave. Larry: Bye, Ryan! Thanks for coming to the game. And you were worried he wouldn't show up. Benny: Mm-mmm, mm-mmm. Not good. No one listens to the squirrel. Sam: I don't know what to do anymore, Benny. I've tried everything. Everything? You tried everything? What are you saying'? I'm saying you have to tell him the truth. I don't think I could do that, Benny. I mean... What's he gonna think of me when he finds out? I don't know. But if you don't tell him… ...you're gonna lose him, Sammy. [Ryan] The green boxes.

[man] OK, they're all loaded up! -

You don't think I know?

Let's get movin'!

Ryan: I change my mind! I don't wanna go! Help!

Sam: Ryan.

Ryan: Help me!

Sam: Watch out!

Benny: Wait for us!

Ryan: Dad!

Sam: Ryan!

Ryan: Don't let them take me!

Sam: Ryan!

Ryan: Help!

Sam: No! Ryan!

Sam: Benny, we need that truck followed.

Benny: Check.

Sam: Get me... the pigeons.

Hamir: Aaahh! I am wanting snake eyes! Come on, baby. Come on, just throw it. Hamir! You are the great loser of all time! What offerings must I make, I wonder?

Benny: Hamir! Hamir! Get a grip on yourself!

Hamir: Benny! I am needing till Friday before I am paying you back!

Benny: No, no. It's Ryan. He’s in one of those green boxes and they took him away in a truck! We've got to find him!

Hamir: That is not good! Not good at all! Aahh! I know! I know! I am telling him, you crazy pigeon! The green boxes go to the big water where stiff lady with spikes on her head…

Benny: Hamir'? I can't understand...

Sam: Just tell me where the green boxes go.

Hamir: Stiff lady, spikies. Yes, like my wife says the truck takes them to her! To her! Though I hate telling bad news, there is more bad news to tell. When the sun rises, the green boxes leave on boat-boat and never return! I am sorry for this. I really am. Hello? [yells]

[Benny] Oh, not good. Not good.

[Bridget] Pfft. You always say that.

Benny: I keep on sayin' it. No one's listenin'. Like a broken record here.

Bridget: OK. When do we leave, Sammy? Benny: Yeah, when do we leave'? Sam: It's not "we." It's me. Let's make this clear. This is now a rescue mission, and I am the only one going. Larry: We'll come too! We're not afraid. Are we, guys? Nigel: "Afraid?" [chuckling] No. You know koalas. More like "scared of things."

Bridget: Look, Ryan's like a cub to all of us. Not that I'll have one of my own at this rate. Nigel: You know, there's that famous… A koala once said, "We will fight them… with peaches."

Bridget: Yeah. Anyway. So we're helping, whatever it takes.

Sam: You want to leave with me? OK. If you don't mind being hunted down, shot at… ...stuffed...

Larry: OK!

Sam: ...or worse, then fine.

Bridget: I have a recurring nightmare about taxidermy and spot remover.

Nigel: Well, they have to catch us before they can stuff us, and I'm fast. Sam: Nobody's leaving but me. Got it?

Others: OK, you're the boss. / You bet.

Nigel: You got the big hair.

Bridget: Absolutely.

[Benny] That's good, Sammy. Hey, way to weed out the weak links. All right, now that they're out of the picture, what's the plan?

Benny: Don't worry about a thing, big guy. I got it all taken care of. I know this city… ...like the back of my paw. We ditch this truck at Fifth Avenue, couple lefts, couple rights, bada-boom, past Broadway and... Aaah! You're there!

Sam: What are you doing here?!

Bridget: Bleer blying blelloo Bly...

Sam: What?

Bridget: We're going to help you find Ryan!

Larry: She said, "We're gonna help you find Ryan."

Sam: Oh, great.

Nigel: Hey, guys. I've got popcorn up my bum. Do I look trashy in this? OK, here's my… Here's my overall plan. Where are we going?

Sam: I only have until sunrise before Ryan is taken away forever! And now I have to worry about you three? [sighs] All right, fine. When do we get off of this thing, Benny?

Bridget: Benny's here?!

Sam: Yeah, he's right there. Benny? Benny! Great. Now what am I gonna do?

Bridget: Guys! Guys! I think we should duck!

Sam: What is she saying'?

Larry: She said, "Duck down!"

Sam: Duck!

[Bridget] Hey! I am not in the mood for a game of footsie or hoofsie or pawsie or...

[Nigel] That wasn't my paw. It was this! I didn't steal it. I borrowed it. It'll light the way to Ryan.

Larry: Whoa. The walls are moving.

Bridget: Oh, right, right. The walls… The walls are moving!

Sam: Larry, uh, hold your breath!

[Bridget] Larry, stay straight!

Sam: Everybody out!

Nigel: All right, don't panic. What we've got to do... [yells]

Bridget: This is definitely not good. Samson!

Sam: Give me your hoof!

Bridget: Help!

Sam: Larry!

Man: Aah! The garbage! It lives!

Bridget: Guys? OK, anybody'? I'm freakin' out.

Sam: What's the hold up'?

Nigel: [muffled] Hello'?

Sam: We're over here, Nigel.

Nigel: [muffled] Right. I'll be there in a minute.

Sam: Think. What did Benny say? Couple of lefts, couple of rights. Bridget, can you see the green lady?

Bridget: I'm looking, I'm looking, but I can't see over anything for a change.

Nigel: How far are you away? You in a different continent? Ow! Is that you, Larry?

Larry: Up here, Nige. Nigel: You're a very furry snake.

Sam: Guys, shh. We don't want to draw attention to ourselves.

Bridget: Oh, dogs. This should be fun for you, Samson.

Sam: Nigel! Grab Bridget!

Bridget: What?

Sam: Run!

Nigel: I'm gonna throw up!

Bridget: Not to nitpick, but shouldn't you be tearing them to shreds?

Sam: All part of the plan. This maneuver's known as the Serengeti Slip. Page ten of the Predator's Playbook.

Bridget: What next'?

Sam: Uh, page 11?

Nigel: Go on, you mutts! Stupid dogs, we could've taken you. Taken you to a... to a disco! Larry, improvise!

[Larry barking]

Sam: Larry, that's not helping.

Larry: OK.

Bridget: Oh, you dogs think you got bark? Well, Samson's got roar! Show 'em, Sam.

Sam: Dig deep, Samson. You're a lion. Be a lion. Eeesh! Look at that guy!

Bridget: Sam, they are frothing at the mouth.

Sam: OK, uh… Larry, coil!

Larry: Check!

Bridget: Sam!

Sam: I improvised. Now jump!

Bridget: Down there?

Sam: Yes! We're leaving, Larry!

Bridget: Teensy question, Samson. With those dogs up there, why didn't you just do what you did in the wild'? You know, lionize 'em or lionate them or lionify them?

Sam: I don't have time to fight dogs,

Bridget. We have to find Ryan, remember'?

Larry: Eww! What is this stinky place?

Sam: It, uh… ...appears to be a human bathing area.

Nigel: You mean humans don't lick themselves clean? Disgusting!

Bridget: Oh, they're hopeless. It is hard to believe they are the top of the food chain.

Nigel: I can't imagine beginning the day without licking myself. No hurry, but is there a plan?

[Samson] Of course there's a plan. We follow this water to the big water, - and then we find the lady with...

Bridget: Larry, either your stomach is growling or something in your stomach is growling.

Larry: Wasn't me.

Nigel: What?

Bridget: Oh, smooth move, Nigel!

Larry: Oh, boy! Twins!

Bridget: OK, Sammy, let's hurry it up now 'cause these guys are seeming to have acid reflux or something!

Sam: Everybody, uh, stay calm.

Bridget: Calm?

Nigel: Not good.

All: Aah!

Stan: I'm gonna say, it looks like you and your crew here are a little far from your borough.

Carmine: Far from your borough! Oh, I love it.

Sam: We're going to the big water. Nigel, show them what we're looking for.

Nigel: Like this?

Bridget: I think it's in her right hand.

Larry: And isn't she blue?

Nigel: I can't do blue. No idea what he's talkin' about. You? It doesn't even register. You're battin' zero, kid,

Sam: Nigel, do the thing with...

Nigel: [sighs] Make your bloody mind up.

The big female with the spikes on her melon! They're tourists. All right, tourists, listen up. Ya gotta get to Battery Park. First you take the Broadway culvert. You're sending them down Broadway culvert? Yeah. What's wrong with that'? They get lost at the sewage treatment plant! What are you talking about? How would you send 'em? You're sendin' 'em the wrong way! The Wall Street culvert is blocked with construction. That is true. All right, then.

Sam: Look guys, you gonna help or not'? Yeah, sure. Of course we're gonna help yas. We're one big family, right? Except for that guy over there. He scares the…

Stan: You done runnin' your mouth yet, Carmine? Huh'? Are ya? Huh'? Huh'? I apologize. He never got over being flushed down the toilet.

Carmine: Yeah.

Stan: Now, follow me because you four won't last ten minutes in this neighborhood. It's a jungle down here.

Carmine: Stan, you know who that is?

Stan: No.

Carmine: That's one of them talkin' kawana bears!

Stan: Oh! How ya doing? "I'm so cuddly! I like you!"

Carmine: I've seen a lot of those thing floatin' down here in the sewer. [laughing]

Stan: That's good! You're makin' me laugh over here.

Nigel: Hey! Just wait for me!

Larry: Are we in the right place?

Nigel: Any place without two hilarious alligators seems a move in the right direction.

Bridget: Sam! Do you see anything up there?

Sam: I sure do.

Bridget: Well, well, well. There she is, like Hamir said.

Nigel: And it's sunrise, which means we're a tad short on time.

Sam: Guys, look. We know the box Ryan's in is green. It's gotta be around here somewhere, so I need you to...

Larry: Yeah. So we should shout out if we see a box that looks exactly like the ones over there.

Sam: It hasn't left yet! We can make it! Let's go!

Bridget: Hold on, Larry! Which way now'?

Larry: Yeah, which way?

Sam: Run! Ryan's on that thing! We've got to stop it!

Bridget: We can't, Sam!

Sam: I don't care!

Larry; No, Sammy, you'll drown!

Sam: I failed. Again.

Nigel: I only count one failure. It's big, but it's just one.

Larry: Goodbye, Ryan. We're gonna miss ya.

Bridget: Samson!

Nigel: What on earth is going on?

Bridget: It's a human, and I do not think he works for the zoo.

Nigel: Perhaps now is a good time to "improvise."

Sam: What?

Nigel: Great! One problem down...

Larry: Far out. Cool.

Nigel: One disaster to go.

Sam: Larry, what are you doing? We're headed for the other boat!

Bridget: How do we steer'? Who knows how to steer'? None of us. We're animals. Great!

Sam: Hold on, Larry. Do that again.

Larry: Do what?

Sam: Whatever you just did, but the opposite!

Larry: But I don't know my opposites!

Sam: No, Larry, like this! Hey, I think I've got it.

Nigel: Well, that was easy. [chuckles] Oh, dear. Has anyone got any eucalyptus wipes'?

Sam: This isn't so difficult. I'm the lion of the sea!

Nigel: Well done, sir. Captain of our team and now captain of this vessel. You're brilliant.

Bridget: Um, I hate to be Miss Negative, but in this melee, we seem to have lost Ryan's boat.

Nigel: What, nothing?

Bridget: Nothing.

He's gone. There! Nelson! The green boxes! - [Nelson] You're sure, eh? - There's my buddies! And my love! Let's go in!

Sam: We'll head away from the sun.

Nigel: No, towards the sun. To the north. Starboard... leftboard. Just follow my finger.

Bridget: Oh, please. You guys wouldn't know the answer if it fell from the sky and hit you in the head .Oh, my! It's a bat! It's a bat! Get it off me! Get it off me!

Sam: Benny!

Nigel: Benny?

Larry: Geese!

Bridget: Are you all right?

Benny: Yes, my princess.

Sam: Benny, you made it!

Benny: Oh. You're my best friend. Best friends should stick together. Even not-so-best friends, who knock you off a speeding garbage truck.

Nigel: Excuse me, but I begged them to go back and get you. Just so you know.

Sam: Benny, could you see Ryan's boat from up there?

Benny: Well, it just so happens I saw it heading that way. And we're in luck! Nelson: How's it goin', eh?

Benny: Canadian geese! Experts at intercontinental travel.

Nigel: Hey, birdie, OK, is it true that Canada has lax immigration policies for koalas?

Sam: I'll take it from here, Nige. My son's out there. We really need your help. Can you lead us to that boat?

Nelson: No problem, eh? Just follow us, and Bob's your uncle. Try not to lag too far behind, eh?

Sam: Hey, Benny, thanks. And FYI, Bridget was very concerned when you fell off the truck.

Benny: Bet you didn't know I could ride geese, did you'? Bareback.

Bridget: Oh, brother.

Larry: Sammy? We going to the wild now'?

Sam: I think we are, Larry.

[Nigel] I can't take it anymore. He's taunting us! Listen! Stop laughing at us, you solar twit! Captain Bligh, sir! Are the ice cream cones ready? The crew, they're on the verge of mutiny.

Benny: Nigel, please.

Nigel: If you don't give us ice creams pretty quick, you're gonna walk the plank, sir!

Sam: Nigel.

Nigel: I don't care if I drown, I'm getting off this death cruise right now. Iceberg! Permission to go down with the ship, sir. [grunts] Hang on! Stuff that! Run! Swim! [yells]

Sam: Nigel?

Nigel: Look, I'm a starfish. [chuckles]

Sam: Guys, look.

Bridget: Gosh. Must feel like a lifetime since you've been here.

Sam: Yeah... a lifetime.

Sam: What the heck?

Larry: Wow! Look! They're releasing the green boxes back into the wild.

Bridget: Larry.

Benny: Guys, they're putting animals inside the green boxes. I just can't figure out why.

Nigel: It's a tunnel to another dimension, can't you see? They go in...

Bridget: Uh, Sam, who is this guy?

Sam: It's all right, Nigel.

Larry: Hey, you think it has anything to do with that'?

Samson: Whoa.

Bridget: Hang on a second. Either I'm starving or Larry is making sense.

Sam: You're right. Those animals are being rescued.
